intro: Benthamia perularioides, commonly known as the desert bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and gray-green, and it produces small, bract-like structures that surround its flowers. Benthamia perularioides is often found in desert scrub and creosote bush communities.
